TCNJ Home / Explore Programs / Photography and Video

Photography and Video

Degree

BFA in Visual Arts

School

Arts and Communication

Department

Art and Art Education

At a Glance

Explore digital and traditional methods of storytelling in photography and video. Courses focus on developing both the technical and conceptual aspects of the mediums, building skills and expertise to engage meaningfully with ideas and culture. To support your professional goals, you’ll be closely mentored by dedicated faculty as you develop your unique, personal vision and build career-readiness. The curriculum also emphasizes the social responsibility held by image creators contributing to our culture.

ApplyRequest Info

Undergraduate Program Options

MAJOR

Photography and Video Specialization
within visual arts

MINOR

Photography and Video Art Minor

You’ll Benefit From:

  • Engaging classes and experiential learning in a creative, collaborative community
  • Cutting-edge facilities for practice with industry-grade technology and tools
  • Contemporary curriculum, local project work, and internship opportunities
  • Opportunities to experience the vibrant art scenes of New York City and Philadelphia
  • First-rate instruction and strong mentorship from talented, accomplished faculty
  • Connections with a strong alumni network for internships and employment

Careers

Your bright future awaits. Graduates go on to pursue a range of rewarding professional roles, including photojournalist; news photographer/videographer; commercial, editorial, and fashion photographer; medical, sports, or travel photographer/videographer; publisher; gallery and museum photographer; portrait and product photographer/videographer; photo editor; studio manager; art producer; and arts administrator.

#2 Best Schools for Fine & Studio Arts in New Jersey

— College Factual, 2024

Courses

Our courses engage with critical ideas, culture, and storytelling. In addition to multilevel digital color photography, you will explore a variety of photographic practices, including large-format printing, intermediate and advanced studio lighting, traditional and alternative development processes, and advanced editing techniques that encourage artistic risk-taking, critical thinking, and research.

The photography and video specialization within the BFA in visual arts also explores the redefinition of photography in a contemporary fine art context, allowing for experimentation with image appropriation, presentation, installation, and interdisciplinary collaboration.

Students complete three rigorous capstone courses (Theory and Practice, Professional Practices, and Senior Thesis) that culminate in an exhibition of their senior thesis portfolio.

Photography/video students have participated in internships at the likes of BET, Hearst Corp., Matthew Barney Studio, MTV, Nickelodeon, and Viacom Media; several have enrolled in graduate programs at Parsons School of Design and Maryland Institute College of Art.

Experiential Learning

The visual arts program takes advantage of the college’s proximity to major museums, galleries, and collections in New York City; Philadelphia; and Washington, D.C., to broaden your exposure to current trends and traditional concepts and techniques.

State-of-the-Art Facilities

The Art and Interactive Multimedia Building houses state-of-the-art computer labs and software, large lighting studio spaces, two specialty printing labs, and a traditional darkroom, offering you a contemporary and relevant learning environment. View our facilities and venues and visit us in person.
